thread.title: Matt Crisafulli scores pair to lift CBA to sectional soccer win
thread.title_full: Matt Crisafulli scores pair to lift CBA to sectional soccer win - Times Union

author: Jess Koehler
title: Matt Crisafulli scores pair to lift CBA to sectional soccer win
text:

(Cindy Schultz / ... more Buy this photo Image 9 of 10 Buy photo Niskayuna's Owen Goldstoff, left, clears the ball as CBA's Noah Keith applies pressure during their Section II Class AA first round soccer game on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, at Christian Brothers Academy in Colonie, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Niskayuna's Owen Goldstoff, left, clears the ball as CBA's Noah Keith applies pressure during their Section II Class AA first round soccer game on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, at Christian Brothers Academy in ... more Buy this photo Image 10 of 10 Matt Crisafulli scores pair to lift CBA to sectional soccer win 1 / 10 Back to Gallery Colonie
CBA soccer senior Matt Crisafulli was sidelined with a broken arm he suffered in the preseason until his return on Oct. 1 against Niskayuna.
He scored the lone goal of the game that afternoon, and on Thursday, Crisafulli struck again in the Brothers' Class AA first-round sectional game against the Silver Warriors.
Behind two goals from Crisafulli, including the go-ahead tally in the 68th minute, and a goal and two assists from senior Noah Keith , No. 8 CBA downed No. 9 Niskayuna 3-1 at CBA.
"We knew they were going to be a tough team," Crisafulli said. "We knew that they play hard. We knew we had to go into this game with the correct mind-set."
CBA (8-8-1) advanced to Monday's quarterfinal and will visit No. 1 Ballston Spa.
"This is our sectional game," Keith said. "It's been our goal to win for three years."
Since Crisafulli's return, the Brothers are 5-0-1. He's scored at least one goal in five of the six games he's played in.
"He's a terrific asset to the team," CBA coach Steve Freeman said. "He brings an added dimension. I'm so happy for him. He's playing well and he's healthy."
CBA and Niskayuna (7-9-1) were scoreless until Crisafulli headed in a free kick by Keith to provide his team a 1-0 edge 14 minutes into the game.
"Noah always looks for me on free kicks," Crisafulli said. "I followed the ball in the air and luckily I was in the right position and was able to head it in."
The score remained intact until Niskayuna senior Noah Daviero leveled the game midway through the second half.
"I was nervous," Crisafulli said. "I didn't want to end my season."
With 12 minutes remaining in the game, Keith found Crisafulli, who sent a shot over the head of Silver Warriors goalie Joe Romano for the winner.
"Noah and Matt play year-round together," Freeman said. "They complement each other very well."
Following a Niskayuna red card, Keith added an insurance goal with 1:20 left to play on a free kick.
"That was a great feeling," Keith said. "What's better than that? Great foul won by Matt."
Brothers goalie Joe Lauria stopped five shots. Romano made five saves for Niskayuna.
CBA will have its hands full on Monday against Ballston Spa.
The Scotties, who defeated the Brothers 4-1 in sectionals last season, are 16-0 and ranked No. 4 in the state.
Ballston Spa handed CBA a 5-1 loss back on Sept. 26.
"Their defense is good, their offense is good ... there's nothing bad about them," Keith said. "We'll have to bring our 'A' game."
Freeman said, "They're terrific. Super experienced. For us, it's a matter of can we compete for the first 10 minutes and kind of go from there."
